edu.illinois.mitra.starl.models

Class ModelRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.illinois.mitra.starl.models.ModelRegistry

  • public class ModelRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
    ModelRegistry is a static container class whose purpose is to reduce explicit typing of the concrete Model subclasses. Each concrete Model subclass must be registered once in the static initializer for use in the rest of the application. The first time the registry is read, it disables all further modification and becomes immutable, essentially like a global constant, thus eliminating the drawbacks of traditional singletons.

    • Method Detail

      • register

        @SafeVarargs
public static void register(java.lang.Class<? extends Model>... classes)
        Registers one or more subclasses of Model to be used in the application. Safe to call repeatedly. Registering subclasses is only allowed before any data has been read from the registry, through the methods create(String, Object...), canCreate(String), etc.
        Parameters:
        classes - one or more Class objects representing the type(s) to be registered
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the type has already been registered or is abstract
        See Also:
        Model

      • create

        public static Model create(java.lang.String typeName,
                           java.lang.Object... args)
                    throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Instantiates a subclass of Model given by the typeName parameter. Although this is a more expensive operation than a raw new, it enables Models to be created with any arguments without knowing the explicit type.

        Waits for concurrent {link #register()} calls to complete and disables future {link #register()} calls.

        Note: because primitive types are boxed in variadic args, they are unboxed before calling the constructor. This means that any constructor that takes a boxed type (Integer, etc.) will not be found; prefer using primitive types.

        Parameters:
        typeName - the type of Model to instantiate
        args - the arguments to the Model constructor
        Returns:
        a new instance of class typeName
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if typeName is not registered or if construction fails
        See Also:
        Model

      • canCreate

        public static boolean canCreate(java.lang.String typeName)
        Checks whether a type is in the registry.

        Waits for concurrent {link #register()} calls to complete and disables future {link #register()} calls.

        Parameters:
        typeName - the type of Model to be looked up in the registry
        Returns:
        whether create(String, Object...) will return successfully, barring a construction failure

      • isInstance

        public static boolean isInstance(java.lang.String typeName,
                                 java.lang.Class<? extends Model> c)
        Checks whether a type is or is a subclass of the given class object.

        Waits for concurrent {link #register()} calls to complete and disables future {link #register()} calls.

        Parameters:
        typeName - the type of Model to be looked up in the registry
        c - the class object to check to be a superclass
        Returns:
        whether the class represented by typeName is an instance of the class represented by c
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if typeName is not registered

      • getTypes

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getTypes()
        Lists the types contained in the registry.

        Waits for concurrent {link #register()} calls to complete and disables future {link #register()} calls.

        Returns:
        an unmodifiable set of typenames
